title: What is the longest running Broadway show? - Quora

response.answer_text: Phantom of the Opera. The show opened on Jan. 26, 1988 and is still running today (1/14/20) for a total of 13,303 performances. Here are the rest of the top ten longest running shows: Phantom of the Opera - 13,303 performancesChicago - Nov. 14, 1996 - still running - 9,626 (This was a revival of the show that originally ran for 936 performances from 1975–1977)The Lion King - Nov. 13, 1997 (still running) - 9,235 performancesCats - Oct. 7, 1982 to Sept. 10, 2000 - 7,485 performances (with a revival in 2016 that run for 593 performancesWIcked - Oct. 30, 2003 to present - 6,769 performancesLes Miserables - March 12, 1987 to May 18, 2003 - 6,680 performances (with revivals in 2006 (463 per.) and 2014 (1,024 per.)A Chorus Line - July 25, 1975 to April 28, 1990 - 6,137 performances (with revival in 2006 (706 per.)Oh, Calcutta (1976 revival) - Sept. 24, 1976 to Aug. 6, 1989 - 5,969 performances (Orig. production in 1969 ran for 1,314 per.)Mamma Mia - Oct. 18, 2001 to Sept. 12, 2015 - 5,758 performances (longest “jukebox” musicalBeauty and the Beast - Apr. 18, 1994 to July 29, 2007 - 5,461 performances.

According to Wikipedia’s list of longest running Broadway shows, “The Phantom of the Opera” is the king of longevity. It opened January 26, 1988, so it’s been running continuously for over 30 years, and is listed at the Internet Broadway Database at 13,318 performances. That makes it the longest running Broadway show of all time. Second place goes to “Chicago,” the revival that opened November 14, 1996; and third place is held by “The Lion King,” which opened November 13, 1997. Note that the longest running off-Broadway show, “The Fantasticks,” ran for 42 years, so “Phantom” still has some work to do.
